message.entry: X Server failed to allocate enough memory for some previous MATLAB graphics or window request
Dumping Core for previous X error... Bye

Connection to the X11 Display Server ({0}) has been lost.
No more graphics windows can no longer be displayed in this session.
Graphics Objects can still be printed, and all commands should still work.
We recommend that you try to save your current session and exit.

The file /usr/lib/X11/XKeysymDB is either missing or incomplete. This will not affect MATLAB, but MathWorks recommends that you fix the problem if using Simulink. In order to ensure that Simulink works as shown in the manual, please reinstall the file XKeysymDB provided on the MATLAB release media. Please refer to the installation instructions shipped with this release.
latest version of {0} app-defaults file not found.\nContact your system administrator to have this file installed.
Unable to open display ''{0}''. You will not be able to display graphics on the screen.
X Server failed to allocate enough memory for some previous MATLAB graphics or window request
